title: Target, Alibaba, Moderna: What to Watch When the Stock Market Opens Today; Fed minutes due Wednesday could clarify when the central bank will begin to tighten policy
text:
* Target was among the first of the big retailers reporting earnings on Wednesday. Its shares slipped 2% premarket after the release, though the earnings topped estimates, and the board approved a new $15 billion share repurchase program.

* Home-improvement retailer Lowe's gained 3.9% premarket after it said it now expects 2021 revenue of about $92 billion. In May, the company said only that it was tracking above a previous forecast for sales of $86 billion.

* Vaccine makers were charting divergent courses ahead of the bell. The Biden administration is expected to call for a third Covid-19 shot for Americans who were fully vaccinated with the Pfizer or Moderna shot. But while Moderna gained 0.5%, Pfizer edged down 0.1%.

* Two U.S. senators are urging the Federal Trade Commission to open a probe into whether Tesla used deceptive marketing practices involving driver-assistance features that the electric-vehicle maker calls Autopilot and Full Self-Driving. Investors don't seem worried. Tesla shares gained 0.6% premarket.

* CDK Global dropped 8.5% premarket after the digital-services firm focused on the car industry reported earnings following Tuesday's close.

* TJX Cos. nudged up 1.9% premarket after the discount retailer delivered its quarterly report. Net sales were up 81% from the same quarter a year ago, when its stores had been closed for part of the time due to the pandemic.

* Bath & Body Works and Cisco Systems are among the companies reporting earnings Wednesday.

Chart of the Day

* Refiners such as Marathon Petroleum are benefiting from a surge in U.S. gasoline demand, but investors remain wary because of rising costs for meeting environmental rules.
